subject: the old shed
object: the far end of the garden
sentence: The old shed abuts the far end of the garden.
paragraph: The property has a spacious garden with plenty of flowers. A small path leads to the other end. The old shed abuts the far end of the garden. Inside, it was filled with various gardening tools. A neighbor's fence was visible just beyond it.

subject: the believers
sentence: The believers trust the ancient legend.
paragraph: In a quiet village, stories were passed down through generations. The villagers held onto these tales dearly. The believers trust the ancient legend. They often gathered to discuss its meanings. Newcomers were always intrigued by their discussions.

subject: the property
sentence: The property borders a dense forest.
paragraph: Purchased years ago, the land was vast and full of potential. Its best feature was revealed upon exploration. The property borders a dense forest. Occasionally, wildlife would venture into the open spaces. The forest canopy provided cool shade on sunny days.

subject: the ticket
paragraph: At the entrance of the museum, visitors were greeted by a guide. Pricing details were clearly displayed next to the door. The ticket costs five dollars. It included access to all the exhibits inside. The fee was considered reasonable by most visitors.

subject: the student
paragraph: Throughout the semester, classes went smoothly. However, as the term ended, tension increased. The student dreads final exams. Late-night study sessions became a routine. Friends often exchanged notes to ensure everyone did well.

subject: the child
sentence: The child fears the dark basement.
paragraph: It was a large house with many rooms to explore. Among these, one area was less inviting. The child fears the dark basement. Every strange noise made it seem even scarier. Often, a sibling would have to accompany them when going downstairs.

subject: the shirt
paragraph: There was a clearance sale at the shopping mall. Many shoppers sought the best deals available. The shirt fits perfectly. Its color matched several pairs of pants back home. Buying it seemed like a great decision.

subject: the library
sentence: The library has a vast collection.
paragraph: Located in the city center, it attracted many students and book enthusiasts. Weekly events often brought in more visitors. The library has a vast collection. From ancient manuscripts to modern novels, there was something for everyone. It was a place people loved to spend hours in.

subject: the audience
object: the final notes of the symphony
sentence: The audience hears the final notes of the symphony.
paragraph: After an hour of beautiful melodies, the performance approached its end. Anticipation filled the concert hall. The audience hears the final notes of the symphony. Applause erupted, appreciating the musicians' efforts. It was an evening to remember.

subject: the teacher
paragraph: During the quiz, several puzzling questions arose. Students consulted their notes feverishly. The teacher knows the answer. A hint was given to guide the class in the right direction. It helped alleviate some of the stress they felt.

subject: the project
paragraph: Though the ideas behind it were innovative, support was dwindling. Previous investors had started looking elsewhere. The project lacks funding. New potential backers were being sought out. The team hoped for better luck in the upcoming presentation.

subject: the storm
paragraph: They'd anticipated bad weather after hearing forecasts. Packing essentials, they stayed indoors, safe from the wind. The storm lasted all night. By morning, debris covered the streets and power was out in many areas. Everyone hoped for clearer skies by noon.

subject: the boy
sentence: The boy likes chocolate ice cream.
paragraph: Birthday parties always meant treats and fun games. Guests eagerly lined up for their share of dessert. The boy likes chocolate ice cream. His friends, however, preferred vanilla or strawberry. There was plenty to go around, accommodating everyone's tastes.

subject: the new building
sentence: The new building looks like a giant wave.
paragraph: Architectural designs had always intrigued residents downtown. A particular project captured significant attention this year. The new building looks like a giant wave. Tourists often stopped to take photos, mesmerized by its curves. It was a future landmark in the making.

subject: the traveler
sentence: The traveler misses the last bus.
paragraph: After a day of exploring the busy streets, evening approached quickly. Keeping track of time was difficult amidst the excitement. The traveler misses the last bus. A friendly local recommended a nearby inn for overnight stay. They hoped to catch the first bus out in the morning.
